If not, see http://www.gnu.org/licenses. //Help Dialog //Create image Dialog What can I do here?
Here you can create a single PDF page from a picture.

Buttons
From top to bottom on the right side.

• Camera: you can choose your picture. Nether from the gallery, the file chooser or take a new one with the camera.
• Crop: Crop and rotate the image. After you applied a filter you must save every time.
• Edit: make a few basic enhancements.
• FAB (orange): create the PDF.

Nice to know:
At the bottom you can see the name of the actual PDF and the format. By pressing this area you can switch between portrait and landscape format for your PDF page. After //Add image Dialog What can I do here?
Here you can images to an existing PDF file.

Buttons
From top to bottom on the right side.

• Camera: you can choose your picture. Nether from the gallery, the file chooser or take a new one with the camera.
• Crop: Crop and rotate the image. After you applied a filter you must save every time.
• Edit: make a few basic enhancements.
• PDF: choose the PDF on which your new page will be added.
• FAB (orange): create the PDF.

Nice to know:
At the bottom you can see the name of the actual PDF and the format. By pressing this area you can switch between portrait and landscape format for your PDF page. //Create text Dialog What can I do here?
Here you can create a single PDF page from text. You have also several options to edit existing PDF files.

Buttons
• FAB (orange): create the PDF.

Nice to know:
At the bottom you can see the name of the actual PDF and the format. By pressing this area you can switch between portrait and landscape format for your PDF page. //Add text Dialog What can I do here?
Here you can add a page with text to an existing PDF file.

Buttons
From top to bottom on the right side.

• Delete: delete pages from an existing PDF.
• Merge: merge two PDF files.
• Protect: protect an existing PDF with a password. You can set an owner (needed to edit PDF file) and an user password (needed only to open PDF file).
• Meta data: edit the meta data of an existing PDF.
• Image: convert PDF to images.
• PDF: choose the PDF which you will manipulate.
• FAB (orange): create the PDF.

Nice to know:
At the bottom you can see the name of the actual PDF and the format. By pressing this area you can switch between portrait and landscape format for your PDF page.
